page.title: 01ATTITUDES
page.content: A large cross section of the public took part in our survey into local attitudes to the arera and ammenities. The overall impressions were that most people whilst satisfied with the area and its{administration}they felt that there were certain areas which could be improved. These areas were{public services,}such as a more frequent bus service to the major towns and a larger number of telephone kiosks for public use. Also some people expressed the fear that a large number of public buildings in the area were falling in to disrepair some to the point of demolition. Within Brynamman it was felt strongly that all efforts should be made to preserve the{Public Hall.}
